answers.answer: Hi!If you were my patient, I would advise you that one of the best things you could do for PCOS is to start birth control.  It helps with almost all the symptoms.  I would not prescribe it for "contraception"  but only for PCOSYour family need not know anything that you prefer to keep to yourself.Your doctor should also do some testing for metabolic syndrome.  The tests should include a hemglobin A1C, Lipid panel, fasting blood sugar, testosterone level, 17 hydroxyprogesterone acetate level, DHEAS level,Chemistry panel and CBC.  For yeast I like to  use Diflucan.  It is NOT sexually transmitted and you could speak freely with your family about it and reassure them that it is not!Good luck!Dr B
